name: Jack_Racine
text:
Jack Racine
Jack Racine was the attorney of Leo Johnson.
Biography
At Johnson's hearing for arson of the Packard Sawmill in March 1989, Racine presented a chart displaying Johnson's brain activity. The chart found that Leo's brain was displaying minimal activity and Racine stated that making him stand trial would be a mockery.
Despite District Attorney Daryl Lodwick's objections, Judge Clinton Sternwood deemed Leo unfit to stand trial.
